item.title: SDR & Capturing Live Earth Images
item.description:
An Software Defined Radio (SDR) is a device where traditional radio hardware components like mixers, filters, demodulators, detectors, amplifiers are replaced by software running on a computer. Which brings the investment cost way down and makes the hobby far more accessible to folks who want to experiment with it.

This allows us to hear a wide variety of radio signals, for example, the ADS-B signals used to track airplanes (like the ones shown on websites such as Flightradar), conversations across multiple ham radio bands, or, as in this post, capturing weather images directly from NOAA satellites.
